alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 05 at 2:42PM CDT until August 05 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Deaf Smith County in the Panhandle of Texas... * Until 345 PM CDT. * At 242 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northwest of Summerfield, or 10 miles west of Hereford, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. * Locations impacted include... Hereford. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
